info.title: Outline API
info.description:
# Introduction

The Outline API is structured in an RPC style. It enables you to
programatically interact with all aspects of Outline’s data – in
fact, the main application is built on exactly the same API.

# Making requests

Outline’s API follows simple RPC style conventions where each API endpoint is
a method on `https://www.getoutline.com/api/method`. Both `GET` and `POST` 
methods are supported but it’s recommended that you make all call using POST.
Only HTTPS is supported and all response payloads are JSON.

When making `POST` requests, request parameters are parsed depending on
Content-Type header. To make a call using JSON payload, you must pass
Content-Type: application/json header, here’s an example using CURL:

```
curl https://www.getoutline.com/api/documents.info
-X POST
-H 'authorization: Bearer MY_API_KEY'
-H 'content-type: application/json'
-H 'accept: application/json'
-d '{"id": "outline-api-NTpezNwhUP"}'
```

Or, with JavaScript:

```javascript
const response = await fetch("https://www.getoutline.com/api/documents.info", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    Accept: "application/json",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    Authorization: 'Bearer MY_API_KEY'
  }
})

const body = await response.json();
const document = body.data;
```

# Authentication

To access API endpoints, you must provide a valid API key. You can create new
API keys in your [account settings](https://www.getoutline.com/settings). Be
careful when handling your keys as they give access to all of your documents,
you should treat them like passwords and they should never be committed to
source control.

To authenticate with API, you can supply the API key as a header
(`Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY`) or as part of the payload using `token` 
parameter. Header based authentication is highly recommended so that your keys
don’t accidentally leak into logs.

Some API endpoints allow unauthenticated requests for public resources and
they can be called without an API key.

# Errors

All successful API requests will be returned with a 200 or 201 status code
and `ok: true` in the response payload. If there’s an error while making the
request, the appropriate status code is returned with the error message:

```
{
  "ok": false,
  "error: "Not Found"
}
```

# Pagination

Most top-level API resources have support for "list" API methods. For instance,
you can list users, documents, and collections. These list methods share
common parameters, taking both `limit` and `offset`.

Responses will echo these parameters in the root `pagination` key, and also
include a `nextPath` key which can be used as a handy shortcut to fetch the
next page of results. For example:

```
{
  ok: true,
  status: 200,
  data: […],
  pagination: {
    limit: 25,
    offset: 0,
    nextPath: "/api/documents.list?limit=25&offset=25"
  }
}
```

# Policies

Many API resources have associated "policies", these objects describe the
current API keys authorized actions related to an individual resource. It
should be noted that the policy "id" is identical to the resource it is
related to, policies themselves do not have unique identifiers.

For most usecases of the API, policies can be safely ignored. Calling
unauthorized methods will result in the appropriate response code – these are
used in the main Outline UI to adjust which elements are visible.

tags.name: Attachments
tags.description:
`Attachments` represent a file uploaded to cloud storage. They are created 
before the upload happens from the client and store all the meta information
such as file type, size, and location.

tags.name: Auth
tags.description:
`Auth` represents the current API Keys authentication details. It can be 
used to check that a token is still valid and load the IDs for the current
user and team.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description:
`Collections` represent grouping of documents in the knowledge base, they 
offer a way to structure information in a nested hierarchy and a level
at which read and write permissions can be granted to individual users or
groups of users.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description:
`Documents` are what everything else revolves around. A document represents
a single page of information and always returns the latest version of the
content. Documents are stored in [Markdown](https://spec.commonmark.org/)
formatting.

tags.name: Events
tags.description:
`Events` represent an artifact of an action. Whether it is creating a user,
editing a document, changing permissions, or any other action – an event
is created that can be used as an audit trail or activity stream.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
`Groups` represent a list of users that logically belong together, for 
example there might be groups for each department in your organization.
Groups can be granted access to collections with read or write permissions.

tags.name: Revisions
tags.description:
`Revisions` represent a snapshop of a document at a point in time. They 
are used to keep tracking of editing and collaboration history – a document
can also be restored to a previous revision if neccessary.

tags.name: Shares
tags.description:
`Shares` represent authorization to view a document without being a member
of the team. Shares are created in order to give access to documents publicly.
Each user that shares a document will have a unique share object.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
`Users` represent an individual with access to the knowledge base. Users
are created automatically when signing in with SSO or when a user is
invited via guest access.

tags.name: Views
tags.description:
`Views` represent a compressed record of an individual users views of a
document. Individual views are not recorded but a first, last and total 
is kept per user.

post.description: An attachment is a database record which maps to a file in storage. Creating an attachment object returns the inputs needed to generate a signed url and upload the file from the client.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

size.description: Size of the file attachment in bytes.

post.description: Load an attachment from where it is stored based on the id. If the attachment is private then a temporary, signed url with embedded credentials is generated on demand.
Retrieve auth object for the current API key
This method allows you to add a user membership to the specified collection.
This method allows you to remove a user from the specified collection.
This method allows you to list a collections individual memberships. It's important to note that memberships returned from this endpoint do not include group memberships.

post.summary: Add a group to a collection
post.description: This method allows you to give all members in a group access to a collection.
This method allows you to revoke all members in a group access to a collection. Note that members of the group may still retain access through other groups or individual memberships.
This method allows you to list a collections group memberships. This is the list of groups that have been given access to the collection.
Delete a collection and all of its documents. This action can’t be undone so please be careful.
Returns a zip file of all the collections documents in markdown format. If documents are nested then they will be nested in folders inside the zip file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

shareId.description: Unique identifier for a document share, a shareId may be used in place of a document UUID

post.description: This method will last all published documents and draft documents belonging to the current user.
This method will list all draft documents belonging to the current user.
This method will list all documents recently viewed by the current user.
This method will list all documents starred by the current user.
This method will list all documents pinned in a collection.
This methods allows you to search your teams documents with keywords. Note that search results will be restricted to those accessible by the current access token.

userId.description: Any documents that have not been edited by the user identifier will be filtered out

dateFilter.description: Any documents that have not been updated within the specified period will be filtered out

context.description: A short snippet of context from the document that includes the search query.
context.example: At Acme Inc our hiring practices are inclusive

ranking.description: The ranking used to order search results based on relevance.

post.description: This method allows you to create or publish a new document. By default a document is set to the collection root. If you want to create a nested/child document, you should pass parentDocumentId to set the parent document.

text.description: The body of the document, may contain markdown formatting.

publish.description: Whether this document should be immediately published and made visible to other team members.

post.description: This method allows you to modify an already created document

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

text.description: The body of the document, may contain markdown formatting.

append.description: If true the text field will be appended to the end of the existing document, rather than the default behavior of replacing it. This is potentially useful for things like logging into a document.

publish.description: Whether this document should be published and made visible to other team members, if a draft

done.description: Whether the editing session has finished, this will trigger any notifications. This property will soon be deprecated.

post.description: Starring a document gives it extra priority in the UI and makes it easier to find important information later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Starring a document gives it extra priority in the UI and makes it easier to find important information later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Pinning a document highlights it on the collection page for everyone on the team.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Pinning a document highlights it on the collection page for everyone on the team.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Move a document to a new location or collection. If no parent document is provided, the document will be moved to the collection root.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Archiving a document allows outdated information to be moved out of sight whilst retaining the ability to optionally search and restore it later.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: If a document has been archived or deleted, it can be restored. Optionally a revision can be passed to restore the document to a previous point in time.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

revisionId.description: Identifier for the revision to restore to.

post.description: Deleting a document moves it to the trash. If not restored within 30 days it is permenantly deleted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the document. Either the UUID or the urlId is acceptable.

post.description: Events are an audit trail of important events that happen in the knowledge base.

auditLog.description: Whether to return detailed events suitable for an audit log. Without this flag less detailed event types will be returned.

post.description: Deleting a group will cause all of its members to lose access to any collections the group has previously been added to. This action can’t be undone so please be careful.
List and filter all the members in a group.
This method allows you to add a user to the specified group.
This method allows you to remove a user from the group.
Creates a new share link that can be used by anyone to access a document. If you request multiple shares for the same document with the same API key the same share object will be returned.
Makes the share link inactive so that it can no longer be used to access the document.
List and filter all the users in the team
Update a users name or avatar. No `id` is required as it is only possible to update the current user at this time.
Promote a user to be a team admin. This endpoint is only available for admin users.
Demote a team admin to regular user permissions. This endpoint is only available for admin users.
Suspending a user prevents the user from signing in. Users that are suspended are also not counted against billing totals in the hosted version.
Activating a previously suspended user allows them to signin again. Users that are activated will cause billing totals to be re-calculated in the hosted version.
Deleting a user removes the object entirely. In almost every circumstance it is preferable to suspend a user, as a deleted user can be recreated by signing in with SSO again.
List all users that have viewed a document and the overall view count.
Creates a new view for a document. This is documented in the interests of thoroughness however it is recommended that views are not created from outside of the Outline UI.

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any.

description.description: A description of the collection, may contain markdown formatting

color.description: A color representing the collection, this is used to help make collections more identifiable in the UI. It should be in HEX format including the #

private.description: Whether this collection is considered to be private. Private collections are only visible to those with a user or group membership.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

parentDocumentId.description: Identifier for the document this is a child of, if any.

emoji.description: An emoji associated with the document.

text.description: The text content of the document, contains markdown formatting

urlId.description: A short unique ID that can be used to identify the document as an alternative to the UUID

pinned.description: Whether this document is pinned in the collection

starred.description: Whether this document is starred by the current user

revision.description: A number that is auto incrementing with every revision of the document that is saved

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

publishedAt.description: The date and time that this object was published

archivedAt.description: The date and time that this object was archived

deletedAt.description: The date and time that this object was deleted

modelId.description: Identifier for the object this event is associated with when it is not one of document or collection

actorId.description: The user that performed the action.

actorIpAddress.description: The ip address the action was performed from. This field is only returned when the `auditLog` boolean is true.

collectionId.description: Identifier for the associated collection, if any

documentId.description: Identifier for the associated document, if any

createdAt.description: The date and time that this event was created

data.description: Additional unstructured data associated with the event

memberCount.description: The number of users that are members of the group

createdAt.description: The date and time that this object was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time that this object was last changed

url.description: URL of the publicly shared document.

createdAt.description: Date and time when this share was created

updatedAt.description: Date and time when this share was edited

text.description: Body of the document, may contain markdown formatting

createdAt.description: Date and time when this revision was created

name.description: The name of this team, it is usually auto-generated when the first SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this team, it will be displayed in the team switcher and in the top left of the knowledge base along with the name.

slackConnected.description: Whether this team has authentication with Slack enabled.

googleConnected.description: Whether this team has authentication with GSuite enabled.

sharing.description: Whether this team has share links globally enabled. If this value is false then all sharing UI and APIs are disabled.

documentEmbeds.description: Whether this team has embeds in documents globally enabled. It can be disabled to reduce potential data leakage to third parties.

guestSignin.description: Whether this team has guest signin enabled. Guests can signin with an email address and are not required to have a Gsuite/Slack SSO account once invited.

subdomain.description: Represents the subdomain at which this team's knowledge base can be accessed.

url.description: The fully qualified URL at which this team's knowledge base can be accessed.

name.description: The name of this user, it is migrated from Slack or Gsuite when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

avatarUrl.description: The URL for the image associated with this user, it will be displayed in the application UI and email notifications.

email.description: The email associated with this user, it is migrated from Slack or Gsuite when the SSO connection is made but can be changed if neccessary.

isAdmin.description: Whether this user has admin permissions.

isSuspended.description: Whether this user has been suspended.

lastActiveAt.description: The last time this user made an API request, this value is updated at most every 5 minutes.

createdAt.description: The date and time that this user first signed in or was invited as a guest.

permission.description: The permissions that this membership grants the user

id.description: Unique identifier for the object this policy references.

permission.description: The permissions that this membership grants the users in the group

firstViewedAt.description: When the document was first viewed by the user

lastViewedAt.description: When the document was last viewed by the user

count.description: The number of times the user has viewed the document.

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found.

Validation.description: The request failed one or more validations.

Unauthorized.description: The current API key is not authorized to perform this action.

Unauthenticated.description: The API key is missing or otherwise invalid.
